security_audit.summary: Reviewed the skill content and found only documentation and example snippets. No file system access, network calls, or execution logic are present. No indicators of malicious intent.

content.user_title: Optimize Python performance with proven profiling
content.value_statement: Slow Python code makes debugging and delivery hard. This skill guides profiling and optimization with practical tools and patterns.
actual_capabilities: Guide CPU profiling with cProfile and pstats
Show line-level profiling with line_profiler patterns
Demonstrate memory profiling with memory_profiler and tracemalloc
Provide optimization patterns for loops, generators, strings, and dict lookups
Explain multiprocessing and async I/O optimization
Cover database batching and query planning basics
limitations: Does not run profilers or benchmarks for you
Requires your environment to install optional tools like line_profiler
Examples are generic and need adaptation to your codebase
No performance guarantees without real measurements

use_cases.title: Reduce API latency
use_cases.description: Identify hot paths and optimize slow request handlers with profiling and caching guidance.

use_cases.title: Speed up pipelines
use_cases.description: Improve batch processing by choosing efficient data structures and I O patterns.

use_cases.title: Performance review
use_cases.description: Build a profiling plan and prioritize fixes for the largest bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Find my bottleneck
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a slow Python function. Show a simple cProfile setup and how to read the top cumulative time results.

prompt_templates.title: Line level analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to use line_profiler on a function and how to interpret its output for optimization choices.

prompt_templates.title: Memory usage check
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a memory_profiler or tracemalloc approach to find peak allocations in my script.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize a pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest optimization strategies for a CPU bound data pipeline, including algorithm, caching, and parallelization options.

output_examples.input: Profile my slow data processing function and suggest optimizations.
output: Use cProfile to identify the top two slowest functions by cumulative time
Replace list accumulation with a generator where possible to cut memory
Consider multiprocessing for CPU bound stages after profiling

best_practices: Profile before changing code to confirm real bottlenecks
Focus on hot paths and high impact functions first
Benchmark before and after each change to validate gains
anti_patterns: Using global variables in hot loops without need

faq.question: Is this compatible with any Python version?
faq.answer: It covers standard tools in modern Python, but some examples may need small edits for older versions.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only and does not execute profiling or modify your code.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my existing tools?
faq.answer: Yes, it describes common tools like cProfile, line_profiler, and py-spy that fit into most workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files?
faq.answer: No, it is a documentation skill and does not read or send any data.

faq.question: What if profiling results are unclear?
faq.answer: Share the top slow functions and call stacks, and it can suggest next profiling steps.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic optimization advice?
faq.answer: It focuses on Python specific profilers and concrete code patterns rather than general tips.
